column1: Querying Attributed DL-Lite Ontologies Using Provenance Semirings
AAAI Technical Track: Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
Attributed description logic is a recently proposed formalism
column3: which enriches description logic concepts and roles with finite sets of attribute-value pairs
column4: called annotations. One of the most important uses of annotations is to record provenance information. In this work
column5: we first investigate the complexity of satisfiability and query answering for attributed DL-LiteR ontologies. We then propose a new semantics
column7: for integrating provenance information with query answering. Finally
column8: we establish complexity results for satisfiability and query answering under this semantics.
